c64.name: Commodore 64
c64.description: The Commodore 64 is an 8-bit home computer introduced in 1982, known for its vast game library and iconic SID sound chip.

amiga.name: Commodore Amiga
amiga.description: The Commodore Amiga is a family of personal computers released in the mid-1980s, famous for its advanced graphics and audio capabilities.

atarist.name: Atari ST
atarist.description: The Atari ST is a line of home computers from Atari Corporation, popular for gaming and music production in the late 1980s.

spectrum.name: Sinclair ZX Spectrum
spectrum.description: The Sinclair ZX Spectrum is an 8-bit personal home computer released in the United Kingdom in 1982, notable for its role in the British gaming industry.

nes.name: Nintendo Entertainment System
nes.description: The Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) is an 8-bit third-generation home video game console that helped revitalize the video game industry in the 1980s.
